  proposition: Yuan Ling et al. published a paper on Multimodal Learning with Foundation Models at the 29th ACM SIGKDD Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining in 2023.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Yuan Ling|PUBLISHED_IN|ACM SIGKDD Conference
    Yuan Ling|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2023
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Yuan Ling|AUTHOR_OF|Research Paper on Multimodal Learning

  proposition: Boyuan Zheng et al. argue that GPT-4V is a generalist web agent when grounded, in an arXiv preprint from 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Boyuan Zheng|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024
    Boyuan Zheng|PUBLISHED_IN|arXiv
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Boyuan Zheng|DESCRIBES|GPT-4V
    GPT-4V|CHARACTERIZED_AS|generalist web agent

  proposition: Chen Qian et al. introduced ChatDev, communicative agents for software development, at the 62nd Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics in 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Chen Qian|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024
    Chen Qian|PUBLISHED_IN|Association for Computational Linguistics
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Chen Qian|INTRODUCED|ChatDev
    ChatDev|PURPOSE|software development

  proposition: Weize Chen et al. proposed the Internet of Agents concept for collaborative intelligence in an arXiv preprint from 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Weize Chen|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024
    Weize Chen|PUBLISHED_IN|arXiv
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Weize Chen|PROPOSED|Internet of Agents
    Internet of Agents|PURPOSE|collaborative intelligence

  proposition: Yuan Li et al. developed MetaAgents for simulating human behavior interactions in LLM-based task-oriented coordination in 2023.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Yuan Li|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2023
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Yuan Li|DEVELOPED|MetaAgents
    MetaAgents|PURPOSE|simulating human behavior interactions

  proposition: Feng He et al. conducted a survey on the emerging security and privacy challenges of LLM agents in an arXiv preprint from 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Feng He|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024
    Feng He|PUBLISHED_IN|arXiv
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Feng He|CONDUCTED|Survey on LLM Agents

  proposition: Yuyou Gan et al. published a survey on security, privacy, and ethical threats in LLM-based agents in an arXiv preprint from 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Yuyou Gan|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024
    Yuyou Gan|PUBLISHED_IN|arXiv
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Yuyou Gan|PUBLISHED|Survey on LLM Agents

  proposition: OpenAI released a research paper on practices for governing agentic AI systems in December 2023.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    OpenAI|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2023
    OpenAI|PUBLICATION_MONTH|December
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    OpenAI|RELEASED|Research Paper on Agentic AI Governance

  proposition: Zhexin Zhang et al. created Agent-SafetyBench for evaluating the safety of LLM agents in an arXiv preprint from 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Zhexin Zhang|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024
    Zhexin Zhang|PUBLISHED_IN|arXiv
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Zhexin Zhang|CREATED|Agent-SafetyBench
    Agent-SafetyBench|PURPOSE|evaluating LLM agent safety

  proposition: Sheng Yin et al. developed SafeAgentBench for benchmarking safe task planning of embodied LLM agents in an arXiv preprint from 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Sheng Yin|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024
    Sheng Yin|PUBLISHED_IN|arXiv
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Sheng Yin|DEVELOPED|SafeAgentBench
    SafeAgentBench|PURPOSE|benchmarking safe task planning

  proposition: Maksym Andriushchenko et al. created AgentHarm, a benchmark for measuring the harmfulness of LLM agents, in an arXiv preprint from 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Maksym Andriushchenko|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024
    Maksym Andriushchenko|PUBLISHED_IN|arXiv
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Maksym Andriushchenko|CREATED|AgentHarm
    AgentHarm|PURPOSE|measuring LLM agent harmfulness

  proposition: Wei Zou et al. investigated knowledge poisoning attacks to retrieval-augmented generation of large language models in an arXiv preprint from 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Wei Zou|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024
    Wei Zou|PUBLISHED_IN|arXiv
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Wei Zou|INVESTIGATED|Knowledge Poisoning Attacks

  proposition: Jiaqi Xue et al. identified vulnerabilities in Retrieval Augmented Generation of Large Language Models in an arXiv preprint from 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Jiaqi Xue|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024
    Jiaqi Xue|PUBLISHED_IN|arXiv
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Jiaqi Xue|IDENTIFIED|Vulnerabilities in Retrieval Augmented Generation

  proposition: Wenkai Yang et al. investigated backdoor threats to LLM-based agents in an arXiv preprint from 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Wenkai Yang|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024
    Wenkai Yang|PUBLISHED_IN|arXiv
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Wenkai Yang|INVESTIGATED|Backdoor Threats to LLM Agents

  proposition: Yifei Wang et al. explored inserting and activating backdoor attacks in LLM agents in an arXiv preprint from 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Yifei Wang|PUBLICATION_YEAR|2024
    Yifei Wang|PUBLISHED_IN|arXiv
    
    entity-entity relationships:
    Yifei Wang|EXPLORED|Backdoor Attacks in LLM Agents
